titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I spent the morning in writing a Sermon for Christmas Day. The post brought me a letter from
He had just learned the rejection of the Revised Prayer Book by the House of Commons. He adds a P.S.:– "
Today's Swedish papers bring the news of the Disaster in the House of Commons. What will now come? Disestablishment
the question, and its answering is not made the easier by the insolvent & reckless language of the extremists, who have long denounced the Establishment as Erastian.
came to see me. He looks extremely well, and is radiantly happy. Oxford evidently suits him: but, of course, we have yet to discover whether he suits Oxford!
, addressing my letter to Y.M.C.A. Johannesburg.
James came to tell me that he had obtained the situation as 2
. I trust that this may mean his definitely starting on his professional life.
^[paragraph strikethrough]^ I prepared Christmas presents for the male members of my staff, eight in number. Also, I gave gifts to the Bryden boys.
